Westfield State University is dedicated to equipping students with the knowledge, skills, and experiences they need to succeed.
Founded in 1839 by Horace Mann, Westfield State was the first co-educational college in America to offer an education without barrier to race, creed, or economic status.
After 175 years, Westfield State continues to impact the economic, social, and cultural vitality of the Commonwealth.
30 minutes from Northampton/Amherst and the Berkshires
2 hours from Boston, Providence, and Albany

Students talk about what sets Westfield apart

Westfield State University is one-of-a-kind, combining big school features like a beautiful residential campus with small school advantages, like small class sizes and excellent student support. Hear what our students have to say, and then come by for a visit. See how our campus is different, how it welcomes you. Start exploring the possibilities.

Engaging Opportunities Contribute to Student Success

is a four-year cohesive series of opportunities designed to involve you both in and out of the classroom. Throughout your time at Westfield State, you will be given the opportunity to discover, develop and practice activities that enhance your education and provide you with real-world experiences. These experiences will transform you into a confident, successful and responsible graduate and contributor in your work and community.

is designed to provide you with activities, guidance and support as you move through each year of college, encountering unique and transformative opportunities along the way including first-year only classes, civic engagement opportunities, professional skills development, study abroad, undergraduate research and creative activity and internships.  Through
, we’ll be with you each step of the way, anticipating the choices that lay ahead and helping you make the best decisions for your academic and professional careers.
Delve into your first year of college with the popular first-year READ and exclusive classes just for first-year students.
Explore the possibilities for your future with individualized guidance to help you align goals, aspirations and careers with curricular and extracurricular activities.
Engage in intensive nontraditional learning experiences like undergraduate research and creative activity, service learning, study abroad and internships.
Prepare for the next step in your journey with capstone courses, projects and senior events that will propel you into your career and/or graduate school.
From service-learning trips and helping others, to excelling in the classroom and on the field: this is Corey's Westfield State Experience.
